{{Use dmy dates|date=September 2018}} {{Use Irish English|date=September 2018}} {{Other people}} {{Infobox person | name = Gavin Duffy | image = File:Gavin Duffy.jpg | birth_name = Liam Duffy<ref>{{cite news |last1=Edwards |first1=Elaine |title=Gavin Duffy expresses regret over involvement in crash that injured young woman 40 years ago |url=https://www.irishtimes.com/news/politics/gavin-duffy-expresses-regret-over-involvement-in-crash-that-injured-young-woman-40-years-ago-1.3654596 |accessdate=8 October 2018 |publisher=Irish Times}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1960|4|29|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Kildare]], Ireland | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = [[Irish people|Irish]] | party = [[Independent politician|Independent]] | spouse = {{marriage|[[Orlaith Carmody]]|1993}} | children = 4 | residence = [[Bellewstown]], [[County Meath]], Ireland | known_for = Main dragon on the Irish version of ''[[Dragons' Den]]'' | occupation = {{Hlist|[[Entrepreneur]]|[[Businessman]]}} | website = {{URL|gavinduffy.ie}} |}} '''Gavin Duffy''' (born '''Liam Duffy'''; 29 April 1960) is an Irish entrepreneur and businessman who was a former part owner of the HRM Group of Companies, one of Ireland's largest recruitment companies.<ref name="whois"/> Duffy is a regular conference speaker at business events in Ireland.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.personallyspeakingbureau.com/speaker/gavin-duffy/|title=Gavin Duffy - Personally Speaking Bureau|accessdate=15 April 2015}}</ref> He was an unsuccessful candidate in the [[Irish presidential election, 2018|2018 presidential election]].<ref name=journal140918>{{cite web|url=http://www.thejournal.ie/businessman-gavin-duffy-becomes-fourth-official-candidate-in-presidential-race-4233912-Sep2018/|title=Businessman Gavin Duffy becomes fourth official candidate in presidential race|first=Daragh|last=Brophy|website=TheJournal.ie|date=14 September 2018|access-date=14 September 2018}}</ref><ref name="Sunday Times">{{cite news |last1=Burns |first1=John |title=Duffy knows the name of the game |url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/duffy-knows-the-name-of-the-game-hgp9t8kpq |work=The Sunday Times |date=16 September 2018 |access-date=7 October 2018}}</ref>
==Early life== Duffy was the youngest of three brothers and lived as a child in [[Sallins]], [[County Kildare]], where his father, Ned Duffy, had a pig farm. His mother, Anne Duffy, ran The Gem restaurant in [[Naas]]. He attended the local primary school, St. Laurence's, in Sallins. The family sold the farm after the outbreaks of [[Classical swine fever|swine fever]] in the early 1970s and moved to [[Drogheda]], [[County Louth]], where they bought a pub. He lived ‘above the shop’ on West Street, while attending St. Joseph's Secondary School. He later went to [[Newbridge College]] in County Kildare where he did his [[Leaving Certificate (Ireland)|Leaving Certificate]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://gavinduffy.ie/who-am-i/|title=About Gavin Duffy}} Retrieved September 28 2018</ref>
==Career== He set up Boyneside Radio in Drogheda when he left school, changing his birth name of Liam to a "cooler" Gavin.<ref name="Sunday Times"/><ref name="whois"/> In 1989, he led the consortium in the country's first licensed provincial local radio station, [[LMFM]], which was sold to [[Wireless Group|UTV]] in 2004 for about €10 million, a sum which Duffy claims holds the Irish and UK record for the highest multiple achieved for a broadcast or publishing asset.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://gavinduffy.ie/blog/about/|title=About Gavin Duffy - Entrepreneur, Media Coach, Dragons' Den Presenter, Public Speaker|accessdate=15 April 2015}}</ref> He founded his media and management consultancy Gavin Duffy and Associates (formerly Media Training) in 1992 with his wife and business partner [[Orlaith Carmody]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://mediatraining.ie/about/|title=Mediatraining.ie - About Us|work=mediatraining.ie}}</ref> Subsequently he worked in [[RTÉ]], where he presented the television business programme Marketplace, contributed to [[Morning Ireland]], and presented Holiday Ireland.
Duffy has been a dragon on all eight series of ''[[Dragons' Den (Irish TV series)|Dragons' Den]]'', produced by [[Raidió Teilifís Éireann|RTÉ]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thejournal.ie/readme/column-gavin-duffy-why-i-cried-on-dragons-den-400438-Mar2012/|title=Column: Gavin Duffy – Why I cried on Dragon's Den|author=Gavin Duffy|work=TheJournal.ie}}</ref>
In 2016, Duffy was awarded a Lifetime Achievement Award from the Chamber of Commerce in Drogheda, County Louth.<ref>{{cite web |title=Chamber stars shine |url=https://www.independent.ie/regionals/droghedaindependent/news/chamber-stars-shine-35254793.html |website=Irish Independent |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Gavin gets his lifetime honour |url=https://www.pressreader.com/ireland/mid-louth-independent/20161130/282892320266939 |website=Mid Louth Independent}}</ref> In 2017, he was the moderator of the [[Fine Gael]] [[Fine Gael leadership election, 2017|leadership election]] debates around the country, which ultimately saw [[Leo Varadkar]] become [[Leader of Fine Gael|party leader]] and [[Taoiseach]].<ref>{{cite web |last1=Finn |first1=Christina |title=Dragon's Den star to moderate Leo and Simon in Fine Gael hustings |url=http://www.thejournal.ie/gavin-duffy-fine-gael-hustings-3406926-May2017/ |website=TheJournal.ie |language=en}}</ref> He has previously worked as an advisor to both [[Fianna Fáil]] and Fine Gael and has coached a number of Taoisigh.<ref name="whois">{{cite web|url=https://www.thesun.ie/news/755759/who-is-gavin-duffy-dragons-den-investor-businessman-and-fake-tan-shareholder/|title=Who is Gavin Duffy? Dragons' Den investor, businessman and fake tan shareholder|work=The Irish Sun|date=23 March 2017}}</ref>
He is the Chairperson of Bizworld Ireland, a non-profit organisation which teaches entrepreneurship to primary school children.<ref>{{cite web |last1=O’Brien |first1=Jennifer |title=BizWorld initiative in schools with Dragons’ Den Gavin Duffy |url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/bizworld-initiative-in-schools-with-dragons-dens-gavin-duffy-gp577wlw2 |website=The Times |language=en |date=26 June 2017}}</ref> He is a patron of Suzanne House<ref>{{cite web |title=Gavin Duffy becomes patron of Suzanne House |url=https://www.suzannehouse.ie/news/73-gavin-duffy-becomes-patron-of-suzanne-house |website=Suzanne House |language=en-gb}}</ref> and the Drogheda Classical Music Series.<ref>{{cite web |title=We're lucky we have so much music here |url=https://www.pressreader.com/ireland/drogheda-independent/20140625/282097749791066 |website=Drogheda Independent}}</ref> He is past Chairman of the Hunting Association of Ireland <ref>{{cite web |title=Ruthless poachers kill deer to order |url= https://www.independent.ie/regionals/droghedaindependent/news/ruthless-poachers-kill-deer-to-order-27143095.html |language=en-ie |website=Drogheda Independent}}</ref> and has organised events in support of hunting and against protests by [[animal rights movement|animal rights activists]].<ref>{{cite web |title= ICABS welcomes IFA president's shunning of pro-hunt event |url= http://www.banbloodsports.com/ln-0808e.htm |language=en-ie |website=Irish Council Against Blood Sports}}</ref>
== 2018 presidential campaign== Duffy was a candidate in the [[Irish presidential election, 2018|2018 presidential election]]. He received the first of four required nominations from [[Meath County Council]] on 3 September,<ref>{{Cite news |date=3 September 2018 |url=https://www.rte.ie/news/politics/2018/0903/991245-presidential-candidates-kerry-cork/ |title=Duffy secures Meath Council presidential nomination |work=[[RTÉ News]] |accessdate=4 September 2018}}</ref> followed on 10 September by nominations from [[Carlow County Council|Carlow]] and [[Wicklow County Council|Wicklow]] county councils.<ref name=rte_20180910>{{Cite news|url=https://www.rte.ie/news/politics/2018/0910/992732-presidential-election-councils/|title=Freeman and Gallagher both secure nominations for Áras bids|date=10 September 2018|work=RTÉ News|access-date=10 September 2018}}</ref> He secured his nomination with the support of [[Waterford City and County Council]] on 14 September.<ref name=journal140918/>
During the course of the election campaign, media reported on an incident in 1978 when, aged 18, Duffy was involved in a vehicular collision in which he caused serious injury to a motorcyclist. He was convicted of careless driving. He expressed regret at the incident.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.irishtimes.com/news/politics/gavin-duffy-expresses-regret-over-involvement-in-crash-that-injured-young-woman-40-years-ago-1.3654596|title=Gavin Duffy expresses regret over involvement in crash that injured young woman 40 years ago|work=The Irish Times|access-date=2018-10-08|language=en-US}}</ref> In an interview on RTÉ Radio 1, Duffy also expressed regret over a ban received for dangerous driving when he was 33, for driving his Porsche at almost twice the 40mph limit towards the brow of a hill. He did not address a ban received at age 21 for driving without tax or insurance.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thejournal.ie/gavin-duffy-dangerous-driving-4276035-Oct2018/|title='My boy racer years are over': Áras hopeful Gavin Duffy expresses regret over historic driving convictions|last=McDermott|first=Stephen|work=TheJournal.ie|date=9 October 2018|access-date=9 October 2018}}</ref> Duffy received 2.2% in the election, finishing last out of the six candidates.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.presidentialelection.ie/|title=2018 results |publisher=Presidential Election returning officer |date=27 October 2018 |accessdate=28 October 2018}}</ref>
==Personal life== Over the last 20 years he has lived in [[Bellewstown]], [[County Meath]], with his wife [[Orlaith Carmody]] and four children.
==References== {{reflist}}

'''Godfrey Stillman Rockefeller''' (May 1, 1899 – February 23, 1983) was an American financier and chairman of the [[Cranston, Rhode Island|Cranston Print Works]], a Rockefeller-owned textile company.<ref name="NYTObit">{{cite news|title=Godfrey S. Rockefeller, Dies; Executive in Textiles Was 83|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1983/02/25/obituaries/godfrey-s-rockefeller-dies-executive-in-textiles-was-83.html|accessdate=30 November 2016|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=25 February 1983}}</ref>
==Early life== Godfrey Stillman Rockefeller was born on May 1, 1899 and was the second son of [[William Goodsell Rockefeller]] (1870–1922) and Sarah Elizabeth "Elsie" Stillman (1872–1935). His paternal grandfather was [[William Rockefeller]] (1841–1922), brother of [[John D. Rockefeller]], the co-founders of [[Standard Oil]].<ref>{{cite news |author= |coauthors= |title=William Rockefeller Dies At Home; Cold Contracted In Rain Fatal |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=xCBQAAAAIBAJ&sjid=uQoEAAAAIBAJ&pg=6813,4611350&dq=william+rockefeller&hl=en |quote=Rockefeller, a founder of the Standard Oil company and one of the wealthiest men in the United States, died of pneumonia Saturday morning at his home.|newspaper=[[The New York Times]] |date=June 25, 1922 |accessdate=2011-01-11 }}</ref> His maternal grandfather was [[James Jewett Stillman]] (1850–1918), a businessman who was [[Chairman|chairman of the board of directors]] of the [[Citibank|National City Bank]].<ref name=grandpaobitnyt>{{cite news |author= |coauthors= |title=James Stillman, Head Of City Bank, Dies Suddenly |url=https://select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0911FE3B5F1B7A93C4A81788D85F4C8185F9 |quote=James Stillman, Chairman of the Board of Directors of the National City Bank, the Presidency of which he resigned in 1908, when he was succeeded by Frank A. Vanderlip, died suddenly yesterday afternoon at 5:30 O'clock at his home, 9 East Seventy-second Street. ...|newspaper=[[New York Times]] |date=Mar 16, 1918 |accessdate=2012-09-16 }}</ref> He was a member of the [[Skull and Bones]] society and graduated from Yale University in 1921.
==Career== Rockefeller served as a second lieutenant in World War One and served as a lieutenant colonel during World War Two. He was partner in [[E. W. Clark & Co.|Clark, Dodge & Company]]; stockholder in the Enterprise Development Corporation; chairman of the Cranston Print Works; director of Benson & Hedges; trustee of the Fairfield Foundation; and had been a director of [[Freeport-McMoRan]] since December 1931.
==Personal life== He was married to Helen Gratz, brother-in-law of [[Edward H. Watson]]. They were the parents of five children:<ref name="NYTObit"/> *[[Godfrey A. Rockefeller|Godfrey Anderson Rockefeller]] (1924–2010). *Peter Rockefeller *Lucy Rockefeller Stewart *Marion Rockefeller Stone *Audrey Rockefeller Blair Rockefeller died on February 23, 1983 of leukemia in [[Greenwich, Connecticut]].<ref name="NYTObit"/>
==See also== *[[Rockefeller family]]

{{Infobox person | name = Augustinus Petrus Kouwenhoven | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1942|9|15|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Netherlands]] | death_date = | death_place = | occupation = Arms dealer | spouse = | parents = | children = }} '''Guus Kouwenhoven'''<ref>see eg. http://www.haguejusticeportal.net/index.php?id=6412</ref>, often misspelled as '''Gus Kouwenhoven''' or '''Guus van Kouwenhoven'''<ref> http://www.liberiapastandpresent.org/TaylorCharles/KouwenhovenGus.htm </ref> (born 15 September 1942, [[Rotterdam]]) is a [[Netherlands|Dutch]] arms dealer convicted for arms trafficking in [[Liberia]] during the presidency of [[Charles G. Taylor|Charles Taylor]].
==Deported from the US== In the 1970, Kouwenhoven was sentenced to two years in prison in the US after being caught in an FBI sting operation while attempting to sell 6 stolen artworks, including a [[Rembrandt]]. He served only 17 days and was deported from the US.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/africa/crimes-against-humanity-anatomy-of-an-arms-dealer-478792.html|title=Crimes against humanity: Anatomy of an arms dealer|first=Daniel|last=Howden|date=18 May 2006|publisher=Independent|accessdate=15 December 2017}}</ref>
==Involvement in Liberia== Kouwenhoven started his career in Liberia in the 1980s as the manager of Hotel Africa<ref>see eg. https://www.theguardian.com/world/2001/may/27/theobserver </ref> and lateron headed the Oriental Timber Corporation (OTC), the main timber company in Liberia in the early 2000s, during the [[Second Liberian Civil War|Liberian Civil War]]. The company was used as a cover for arms smuggling.<ref name=iol-arrest/><ref name=taylor-made>{{cite web|url=https://www.globalwitness.org/sites/default/files/pdfs/taylormade2.pdf|title=Taylor Made: The Pivotal Role of Liberia's Forests and Flag of Convenience in Regional Conflict|publisher=Global Witness|date=2001|accessdate=14 December 2017}}</ref> The [[United Nations]] issued an order in 2001 banning him from traveling because of arms trafficking.<ref name=taylor-made/>
==Trials== Kouwenhoven was arrested in the Netherlands on 18 March 2005 and stood trial at the [[Judiciary of the Netherlands#District Courts|Court of First Instance]] in [[The Hague]], starting 24 April 2006, charged with arms smuggling and war crimes in Liberia in the 90s, for which the Dutch public prosecutors sought a 20-year jail sentence and a fine of €450,000. The court tried to summon Charles Taylor to testify against Kouwenhoven. On 7 June 2006 Kouwenhoven was sentenced to 8 years in jail for arms smuggling. The court did not find him guilty of war crimes. Both the public prosecutors and Kouwenhoven sought a higher court appeal and Kouwenhoven was released in March 2007 in anticipation of his new trial.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rd.nl/vandaag/binnenland/kouwenhoven-vrij-tot-rechtszaak-1.1150680|title=Kouwenhoven vrij tot rechtszaak|date=19 March 2017|language=nl|accessdate=14 December 2017|publisher=Reformatorisch Dagblad}}</ref>. The [[Judiciary of the Netherlands#Courts of Appeal|Court of Appeal]] in The Hague acquitted him of all charges on 10 March 2008 and sharply criticized the work of the prosecution.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.haguejusticeportal.net/index.php?id=6412|title=Guus Kouwenhoven|publisher=Hague Justice Portal|accessdate=14 December 2017}}</ref>
The prosecution appealed the acquittal to the [[Supreme Court of the Netherlands|Supreme Court]] on 20 March 2008. In April 2010 the Supreme Court ordered a re-trial at the court in [[Den Bosch]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.haguejusticeportal.net/index.php?id=11630|title=Dutch Supreme Court quashes Court of Appeal decision in Guus K. case|date=20 April 2010|accessdate=14 December 2017|publisher=The Hague Justice Portal}}</ref> In November 2014, the court in Den Bosch was to hear arguments for dismissal as there were no witnesses available to testify. The Prosecutor Cara Pronk-Jordan wished to have the earlier anonymous interviews used as evidence.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.telegraaf.nl/binnenland/23261631/__Anonieme_getuigen_kwijt__.html|title=Anonymous witnesses lost case - Kouwenhoven kwijt|language=nl|publisher=[[De Telegraaf]]|date=10 February 2017|accessdate=14 December 2017}}</ref> Kouwenhof fled to South Africa in December 2016, claiming medical grounds<ref name=iol-arrest/>. On 21 April 2017, Kouwenhoven was convicted in absentia to a 19 year jail sentence for illegal arms trafficking and complicity in war crimes in Liberia and Guinea.<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://nos.nl/artikel/2169410-zakenman-kouwenhoven-krijgt-19-jaar-voor-wapenhandel-in-liberia.html |title=Zakenman Kouwenhoven krijgt 19 jaar voor wapenhandel in Liberia |language=Dutch |publisher=[[Nederlandse Omroep Stichting]] |date=21 April 2017 |accessdate=23 April 2017}}</ref>
Kouwenhoven was arrested on a Dutch warrant on Friday 8 December 2017 at his home in [[Fresnaye, Cape Town|Fresnaye]], [[Cape Town]], by the [[South African Police]] and appeared before the [[Magistrate's court (South Africa)|Cape Town Magistrate's Court]] from Tuesday 12 December 2017.<ref name=iol-arrest>{{cite web|url=http://www.iol.co.za/weekend-argus/news/gunrunner-arrested-in-cape-town-for-war-crimes-in-liberia-12329332|title=Gunrunner arrested in Cape Town for war crimes in Liberia|date=9 December 2017|first=Mike|last=Behr|publisher=IOL|accessdate=14 December 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.news24.com/SouthAfrica/News/dutch-arms-dealer-used-blood-money-to-finance-his-lavish-lifestyle-in-cape-town-court-hears-20171214|title=Dutch arms dealer used 'blood money' to finance his lavish lifestyle in Cape Town, court hears |date=14 December 2017|accessdate=14 December 2017|publisher=IOL|first=Caryn|last=Dolley}}</ref>

'''Hans Gerling''' (born June 6, 1915 in Cologne, † August 14, 1991) was a German businessman who headed the [[Gerling Konzern]], one of Europe's largest insurance groups, from 1949 until his death.
He was the second of three sons of Auguste, b. Hoffmeister and [[Robert Gerling]], founder of the Cologne-based Gerling insurance company. Hans Gerling joined the Gerling Konzern in 1937 and became CEO in 1949. <ref>{{cite web|title=Gerling-Konzern Versicherungs-Beteiligungs-Aktiengesellschaft History|url=http://www.fundinguniverse.com/company-histories/gerling-konzern-versicherungs-beteiligungs-aktiengesellschaft-history/|website=Funding Universe|accessdate=12 December 2017}}</ref> <ref>{{cite book|title=Major Financial Institutions of Europe 1993|date=December 18, 1992|publisher=Springer|isbn=978-1853338779|page=98}}</ref>
After the death of Robert Gerling in 1935, management of the [[Gerling-Konzern]], which was the largest privately owned insurance company in Europe, passed first to Walter Forstreuter, then to Hans Gerling's brother Robert Gerling II, and finally, in 1939 when Robert Gerling II emigrated to the United States, to Hans Gerling. At the end of World War II, the US military government allowed the Gerling insurance company to reopen for business with Forstreuter at its head.<ref>{{cite web|title=Gerling-Konzern Versicherungs-Beteiligungs-Aktiengesellschaft History|url=http://www.fundinguniverse.com/company-histories/gerling-konzern-versicherungs-beteiligungs-aktiengesellschaft-history/|website=Funding Universe|accessdate=12 December 2017}}</ref> On November 13, 1948 Forstreuter resigned from the chairmanship in favor of Hans Gerling, who became chairman of all Gerling companies in January 1949.
Control of the Gerling insurance group sparked a long legal battle between the three brothers. A settlement provided that Hans Gerling and initially his brother Walter retained the German companies of the Gerling Group, Robert received DM 30 million as compensation and the Swiss and American companies.<ref>{{cite web|title=VERSICHERUNGEN / GERLING-KONZERN Der Bruderkrieg|url=http://www.spiegel.de/spiegel/print/d-41761252.html|website=Der Spiegel|accessdate=12 December 2017}}</ref>
Hans Gerling initiated the construction of the Gerling skyscraper in Cologne Gereonsviertel, inviting sculptor [[Arno Breker]] to participate in the design. It was completed on January 25, 1953.
In 1954, Hans Gerling established Gerling-Konzern Globale Rückversicherungs-AG, an international reinsurance holding company, and Gerling Globale became the first German insurance company to expand overseas. <ref>{{cite web|title=Gerling-Konzern Versicherungs-Beteiligungs-Aktiengesellschaft History|url=http://www.fundinguniverse.com/company-histories/gerling-konzern-versicherungs-beteiligungs-aktiengesellschaft-history/|website=Funding Universe|accessdate=12 December 2017}}</ref> Gerling founded on April 20, 1954, the Gerling Speziale Kreditversicherungs-AG, which initially operated credit, suretyship and fidelity insurance. After the departure of his youngest brother Walter, Hans Gerling took over in 1965 the sole management.
Together with [[Herbert Quandt]] and [[Emil Georg Bührle]], Hans Gerling financed Ivan David Herstatt's [[Herstatt Bank]], in which Gerling held a majority share.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Harald Wixforth, Bielefeld / Bremen|title=Upheavals, Continuities and Structural Change at Financial Center Cologne after WWII|url=http://www.ibf-frankfurt.de/ibf_paper_series/IBF_Paper_Series-11_17-WIXFORTH-Umbrueche_Kontinuitaeten_und_Strukturwandel-First_Draft.pdf|website=IBF Frankfurt|publisher=IBF Paper Series|accessdate=12 December 2017|page=14}}</ref> In 1974, enormous losses at the Herstatt Bank forced Hans Gerling to sell the Gerling insurance business.<ref>{{cite news|title=THE BILLIONAIRES 1991|url=http://archive.fortune.com/magazines/fortune/fortune_archive/1991/09/09/75462/index.htm|publisher=Fortune Magazine}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Gerling Continuing Talks With Zurich Insurance Unit|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1974/11/28/archives/gerling-continuing-talks-with-zurich-insurance-unit.html|website=nytimes|publisher=New York Times|quote=Negotiations between the West German banking consortium Hans Gerling and the Zurich Insurance Group in an attempt to avoid the Bankhaus I. D. Herstatt settlement proceedings turning into a bankruptcy case are continuing.}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=GESTORBENHans Gerling|url=http://www.spiegel.de/spiegel/print/d-13489676.html|website=spiegel|publisher=Der Spiegel|accessdate=14 December 2017}}</ref>
He later recovered control of the company, which is now run by his son [[Rolf Gerling]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Deutsche Bank, Swiss Re Shuffle Gerling Holdings|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB105230274217032500|website=wsj|publisher=Wall Street Journal|accessdate=14 December 2017}}</ref>
Hans Gerling was inducted into the [[Insurance Hall of Fame]] in 2000, alongside [[Otto Von Bismarck]], one of only seven Germans to be so honored in the history of the industry.<ref>{{cite web|title=Insurance Hall of Fame|url=http://www.insurancehalloffame.org/laureateprofile.php?laureate=73|website=insurancehalloffame|publisher=Insurance Hall of Fame|accessdate=15 December 2017}}</ref>
'''Books and films about Hans Gerling'''
*Thoughts of an outstanding entrepreneur, book by Hans and [[Rolf Gerling]]<ref>{{cite book|last1=Gerling|first1=Hans and Rolf|title=Thoughts of An Outstanding Entrepreneur|isbn=978-3932425271}}</ref>
* Dynastien in NRW: Gerling - das Geschäft mit der Sicherheit. WDR-Fernsehen<ref>{{cite web|last1=Dietmar|first1=Carl|title=Dynastien in NRW: Gerling Wallraff wälzt sich im Chefbüro|url=https://www.ksta.de/dynastien-in-nrw--gerling-wallraff-waelzt-sich-im-chefbuero-11880520|website=ksta|publisher=Kölner Stadtanzeiger|accessdate=14 December 2017}}</ref>
*"Mahlzeit, Herr Direktor" by [[Günther Wallraff]]: Steckbrief eines Unerwünschten Die lange Günter-Wallraff-Nacht | WDR Fernsehen<ref>{{cite web|title=Steckbrief eines Unerwünschten|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111127035447/http://www.wdr.de/tv/wdr-dok/sendungsbeitraege/2011/1119/unerwuenschten.jsp|publisher=WDR Dco|accessdate=14 December 2017|quote=„Mahlzeit, Herr Direktor“ über Wallraffs Einsatz als Pförtner beim Kölner Versicherungskonzern Gerling.}}</ref> *

{{refimprove|date=March 2018}}
The '''Indian Communication Finance Service''' ('''ICFS''') earlier known as '''Indian Post & Telecommunication Accounts and Finance Service''' ( '''IP&TAFS''') is a Group "A" [[Central Civil Services (India)|Central Civil Services]] of the [[Union of India]]. The Service was started in the year 1972 for prudent and professional management of the finances of the [[Indian Postal Service|Department of Posts]] and [[Department of Telecommunications]] which were the sole provider of the communications needs of the country at that time. Gradually, over time the service has crystallized into a professional cadre of over 376 officers. In 2017, 25 officers were recruited through prestigious [[Civil Services Examination]] conducted by [[Union Public Service Commission]]. This services contributes to the largest share of Non-Tax Revenue collection/assessment for Government of India.
== History ==
After the foundation of Service in 1972, the first batch was recruited in 1974. Mr [[S.D. Saxena]] and Ms [[Ruchira Mukherjee]] (Ex Adviser Finance), belong to the first batch of 1974. Initial batches of the service were very small in number, however, with growth in Telecom in India need was felt for more number of officers, hence subsequent batches of the service (e.g. 1994, 1995 etc.) were large batches.
== Recruitment and induction ==
After recruitment through [[Civil Services Examination]], the officers undergo a foundation course with the officers of other services ([[Indian Administrative Service|IAS]], [[Indian Foreign Service|IFS]] & [[Central Services Group "A"]]) lasting about 4 months at the [[Lal Bahadur Shastri National Academy of Administration]] at [[Mussoorie]]. This is followed by a 6 months of rigorous professional training in Financial Management at the National Institute of Financial Management,[http://www.nifm.ac.in/] [[Faridabad]] which is a specialized training institute under the [[Ministry of Finance (India)|Ministry of Finance]], [[Government of India]]. Thereafter, for further training in Telecom technologies and Postal procedures the officers are deputed for 10 months at National Institute of Communication Finance (NICF) at [[Ghitorni]] (New Delhi) In between this classroom training schedules, the officers are also deputed for on job field training in both telecom side and postal side.
After successful completion of training the officers are posted to work in the Department of Post or Department of Telecommunications as Assistant Chief Accounts Officers or Assistant Controller of Communication Accounts respectively in the Junior Time Scale Grade. ICFS has also a Group-B Cadre and Asst Accounts Officers, Accounts Officers and Sr.Accounts Officers are placed under this cadre with All India Service liabilities. These Officers are appointed on promotion selected through a Departmental Examination.
== Duties performed by Officers of ICFS GR.’A’ ==
# Assessment and Collection of '''License fee and Spectrum usage''' charges paid by Telecom Licencers. # '''Spectrum Auction''' of 2G, 3G and 4G # '''Policy making''' in Department of Telecommunications and Department of Posts. # '''Financial Management''' of Department of Posts and Department of Telecommunications. # Internal '''Audit''' of Department of Telecommunications and Department of Posts. # Designated Monitoring Authority of '''Bharat Net Project''' (backbone of Digital India) # '''Accounting''' of Department of Posts and Department of Telecommunications. # '''Pension''' Management of DoT, DoP, BSNL and MTNL. # '''Human Resource Development''' and Capacity Building of IP&TAFS, Gr.’A”
<ref>http://www.nicf.gov.in/pdf/service_profile_ip&t_afs_gr_a.pdf</ref>
As in the other Central Services, the officers are liable to be transferred and posted in anywhere in India. The officers of ICFS are working in [[Department of Telecom]], [[Indian Postal Service|Department of Posts]], and various other ministries and statutory bodies of Govt of India on deputation.
In Department of Telecommunications, the officers are posted at DOT Headquarters as Adviser, Sr DDG, DDG, Directors & ADG. In field units the officers are posted as Controller or Joint Controller of Communication Accounts (CCA/JCCA) which is involved in the collection of License fees and Spectrum Usage Charges from Airtel, Vodafone, Idea, BSNL, MTNL and other service providers and for checking and disbursing claims received under the Universal Service Obligation fund as well as administrative functions such as settlement of pension cases of DoT Employees, maintaining General Provident Fund accounts of DoT Employees, . The amount collected under licensing is approximately Rs.44000 crores for the Financial Year 2017-18. The CCA units also assist in the administration of Universal Service Obligation Fund under the [[Ministry of Communications and Information Technology (India)|Ministry of Communications & IT]] for providing telecom service in rural/remote areas of the country involving (a) planning & forecasting, (b) tendering, (c) costing, (d) disbursement of support to service providers, and (e) monitoring. The collection towards USO for the 10th Plan Period is around Rs. 13000 crores.
In the Department of Post, the officers from this service are manning the offices of FA / DDG / GM, Director, ADG /Dy Director / ACAO of Postal Accounts located at DOP Headquarters and in all states. The work in these offices mainly comprises maintaining General Provident Fund accounts of the staff employed in a particular postal circle, settlement of pension cases, checking of money order deliveries and NSCs, budgeting and financial control, Internal Audit of Postal Units and rendering financial advice to the concerned Head of the Circle.
Besides IP&T AFS, Gr. ‘A’ officers can be appointed on deputation to Central Government, State Governments, Central Staffing Scheme, Autonomous Organizations/ Subordinate Organizations, PSUs and UN Organizations/International Organizations like world Bank, Asian Development Bank in various capacities.
== Cadre Controlling Authority ==
Member Finance, [[Telecom Commission of India]] is Cadre Controlling Authority of ICFS (earlier known as IP&TAFS), Group "A"& "B". Member Finance is an ''ex officio'' Secretary to Government of India.Now Smt Anuradha Mitra is helding post of Member Finance.

{{Infobox person | name = Johan Henrik Andresen | image = 2017-03 Johan Andresen.jpg | caption = Andresen in March, 2017 | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1961|07|25}} | birth_place = Oslo | alma_mater = Rotterdam School of Management
Dartmouth College | occupation = Chairman of Ferd AS 2012-current CEO of Ferd AS 1998-2012 | known_for = Ferd AS | children = Alexandra
Katharina }} '''Johan Henrik Andresen''' (born 25 July 1961) is a [[Norway|Norwegian]] industrialist and investor.{{cite web | title=Johan H. Andresen | url=http://www.kfsm.com/business/sns-506a7fd3d42d4a08886cf562426d09b5-2,0,1096596.photo | work= | publisher=[[KFSM-TV]] | author= | accessdate=2009-11-04}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} Since 1998, Andresen has been the owner of [[Ferd (company)|Ferd]], one of the largest privately held companies in Norway. He served in the position of CEO from 1998 to 2012, and has been the chairman of the board since 2012. In the magazine Kapital’s list of the 400 richest Norwegians, Andresen is ranked as number five, with a net worth equaling more than USD 3.27 billion.{{cite web|url = http://www.kapital400.no|title = Kapital 400 rikeste|date = |accessdate = |website = |publisher = |last = |first = }} While his father Johan H. Andresen Sr. lived, Andresen added 'Jr.' to his name, but ended this practice when his father died in 2011.{{cite web|last1=Andersen|first1=Øystein|title=Endelig har tobakk- prinsen stumpet røyken|url=http://www.dagbladet.no/2012/05/14/nyheter/innenriks/andresen/neringsliv_kjendis/21584976/|website=dagbladet.no|publisher=Dagbladet|accessdate=17 October 2014|language=Norwegian|date=15 May 2012}} == Early life == Andresen was born in 1961 in [[Oslo]], as the son of industrialist [[Johan Henrik Andresen (1930–2011)|Johan Henrik Andresen]] (1930–2011), and Swedish [[Bielke|noblewoman]] [[Marianne Andresen|Marianne Ebba Therese Bielke]]. He received a [[Bachelor of Arts]] degree in Government and Policy Studies from [[Dartmouth College]] in 1988, and an [[Master of Business Administration|MBA]] in 1993 from the [[Rotterdam School of Management]].{{cite web|url=http://www.orkla.no/bedriftsforsamling/johan-h-andresen|title=Orkla ASA — Johan H. Andresen jr. (f. 1961)|date=2008-07-02|publisher=[[Orkla Group|Orkla ASA]]|language=Norwegian|accessdate=2009-11-06|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110104190650/http://orkla.no/bedriftsforsamling/johan-h-andresen#|archive-date=2011-01-04|dead-url=yes|df=}} == Personal life == Andresen is married to Kristin Gamlemshaug. The couple has two daughters, [[Katharina Andresen|Katharina]] and [[Alexandra Andresen|Alexandra]]. In 2007, Andresen transferred most of the Ferd Holding shares, for an estimated value of NOK 12 billion, to his daughters.{{cite web|url=http://www.kjendis.no/2007/12/21/521892.html|title=Gir døtrene 12 milliarder|last=Solend|first=Per Arne|author2=Ulf Andre Andersen|date=2007-12-21|publisher=''[[Dagbladet]]''|language=Norwegian|accessdate=2009-11-05}} He is the grandson of [[Johan H. Andresen]], and the great-grandson of [[Johan Henrik Andresen (1815–1874)|Johan Henrik Andresen]]. == Professional career == Andresen was Product Manager in International Paper Co., USA from 1989 to 1991. In 1993 he became a Partner in the Norwegian industrial group Tiedemanns-gruppen. He succeeded his father as the sole owner and CEO in 1998, and thus became the fifth generation of the Andresen family in charge of the company since the first Johan H. Andresen bought the tobacco company J.L. Tiedemanns Tobaksfabrik in 1849.{{cite web|url = http://www.ferd.no/en/startpage|title = Historyline|date = |accessdate = |website = |publisher = |last = |first = }} In 1998 the tobacco production of Tiedemanns Tobaksfabrik was merged with the [[Scandinavian Tobacco Company]],{{cite encyclopedia|url=http://www.snl.no/Johan_Henrik_Andresen_jr. |title=Johan Henrik Andresen jr. |encyclopedia=[[Store norske leksikon]] |language=Norwegian |accessdate=2009-11-05 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120927081649/http://snl.no/Johan_Henrik_Andresen_jr. |archivedate=September 27, 2012 }} and in 2005 Andresen sold all his shares in the company for [[Norwegian Krone|NOK]] 3.3 billion. Tiedemanns-gruppen changed its name to Ferd in 2001. Today, Ferd owns Elopak, Aibel (50%),TeleComputing, Interwell and Swix Sport, among other companies, in addition to substantial portfolios of stock, hedge fund investments, Private Equity and property. The company’s net asset value has grown from NOK 7,4 billion in 2003 to NOK 24,3 billion as of year’s end 2013.{{Cite book|title = Ferd Annual Report 2013|last = |first = |publisher = |year = |isbn = |location = |pages = }} In September 2006, Andresen famously attempted to acquire the Swiss packaging and former weapons producer [[Schweizerische Industrie Gesellschaft|SIG]], by placing a bid of NOK 11 billion for 50.01% of the shares in the company. Andresen's plan was to merge SIG with Ferd-owned Elopak, making it the world's second largest packaging manufacturer.{{cite web|url=http://www.dn.no/forsiden/naringsliv/article881693.ece|title=Andresen jr. med gigantbud|last=Bjørndal|first=Bente|date=2006-09-25|publisher=''[[Dagens Næringsliv]]''|language=Norwegian|accessdate=2009-11-07}} SIG, however, initiated a [[bid price|bidding war]], and in March 2007 Ferd announced that it would no longer be pursuing the transaction. This would have been one of the largest acquisitions in Norwegian history.{{cite web|url=http://www.dn.no/forsiden/borsMarked/article1046542.ece|title=Andresen jr. kaster kortene i SIG|last=Langum Becker|first=Cecilie|date=2007-03-12|publisher=''[[Dagens Næringsliv]]''|language=Norwegian|accessdate=2009-11-07}} Andresen chairs the Council on Ethics for the Government Pension Fund Global.{{cite web|url =http://etikkradet.no/en/council-members-2/|title =Counsil on Ethics, Council Members|date =|accessdate =|website =|publisher =|last =|first =|archive-url =https://web.archive.org/web/20150126194917/http://etikkradet.no/en/council-members-2/#|archive-date =2015-01-26|dead-url =yes|df =}} He is Chairman of the Board of Ferd AS, and serves as a board member of Skandinaviska Enskilda Banken AB (SEB) in Sweden, NMI – Norwegian Microfinance Initiative, Junior Achievement –Young Enterprise, Europe, and Junior Achievement –Young Enterprise, Norway (Ungt Entreprenørskap).{{cite web|url = http://ferd.no/en/about_ferd/board_and_administration/board_of_directors|title = Ferd home page, Board of Directors|date = |accessdate = |website = |publisher = |last = |first = }} == Philanthropy == In 2006, Andersen initiated a collaborative project between public and private interests. This led to the launching of NMI – Norwegian Microfinance Initiative in 2008, a microfinance institution aimed at stimulating growth in impoverished countries. In 2009 he formed Ferd Social Entrepreneurs, a separate non-commercial business area within Ferd that supports selected organizations, projects and individuals in activities where the social results carry greater weight than the financial results. == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == *{{cite web | title=Norwegians bare it all | url=http://www.tri-cityherald.com/942/story/764079.html | work= | publisher=''[[Tri-City Herald]]'' | author=Robertson, Ken | date=2009-10-22 | accessdate=2009-11-04}} {{Dead link|date=November 2010|bot=H3llBot}} *{{cite web | title=Norway launches $117 mln microcredit fund | url=https://www.reuters.com/article/latestCrisis/idUSL02501576 | publisher=Reuters | author=Stoltz, Christine | date=2008-06-02 | accessdate=2009-11-04}} *[http://www.hegnar.no/skattelisten/article396773.ece www.hegnar.no] {{DEFAULTSORT:Andresen, Johan}} [[Category:1961 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Oslo]] [[Category:Norwegian people of Swedish descent]] [[Category:Norwegian expatriates in the United States]] [[Category:Dartmouth College alumni]] [[Category:Norwegian businesspeople]] [[Category:Norwegian billionaires]]

{{Infobox person | name = José Filipe Torres | image = Jose Filipe Torres.png | alt = | caption = [[Jose Filipe Torres]] at The Berlin International Economics Congress in 2011 | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1976|04|13|df=y}} | nationality = [[Portugal|Portuguese]] | occupation = [[CEO]] of [[Bloom Consulting]] }}
'''José Filipe Torres''' (born 13 April 1976) is a [[People of Portugal|Portuguese]] [[entrepreneur]], [[public relations|spokesperson]], one of to 3 international experts on [[Branding national myths and symbols|country branding]] and [[nation branding]], providing advisory for the OECD. 22 years of experience, 16 of which dedicated to Country Branding<ref>http://placebrandobserver.com/interview-jose-torres-bloom-consulting/</ref>.
==Biography==
Studied in Parson, [[New York City]] and Central St Martins, [[London]]. He is the CEO and Founder of [[Bloom Consulting]]<ref>http://www.citynationplace.com/global/speakers#</ref>, a company he set up in 2003 and, according to [[The Economist]] and other sources<ref>{{cite news |title=Country branding consultant Jose Filipe Torres on branding Serbia|url=http://www.economist.com/node/8147055?Story_ID=E1_RTQSDVV | work=The Economist | date=2006-11-11}}</ref>, he is cited as being "a world renowned specialist in country branding". He was quoted by ''[[Forbes]]'' about nation branding, cautioning that, "Good brand positioning doesn't always mean more tourism, economic development and foreign investment"<ref name=Forbes>{{cite journal|magazine=Forbes|url=https://www.forbes.com/2009/10/05/well-liked-countries-lifestyle-real-estate-tourism-america.html|title=World's Most Well-Liked Countries|date=2010-05-09|accessdate=2011-08-04}}</ref>. His clients include Bulgaria, Finland, Spain, Portugal, Paraguay, Jamaica, Sweden, Germany, Norway and many more spread through 4 different continents<ref>http://www.cd-n.org/index.php?An-Interview-with-Jose-Filipe-Torres-CEO-and-Head-of-Strategy-at-Bloom-Counceling</ref>.
In 2011, Torres initiated a new research project which investigated 144 countries trade performance and 157 countries tourism performance, with analysis on dozens of variables. The report was given the name Bloom Consulting Country Brand Ranking<ref>http://countrybrandingwiki.org/index.php/Rankings_-_Country_by_Country#Bloom_Consulting_Country_Brand_Ranking_Methodology</ref> and has been published all around the world including CNN<ref>http://travel.cnn.com/one-country-reigns-supreme-country-branding-ranking-257711/</ref>. Most recently Torres developed a new analytical software called Digital Demand D2© enabling Countries, Regions and Cities to measure their Brand appeal and reputation in the Digital World<ref>http://www.digitalcountryindex.com/</ref>. With this tool Bloom Consulting developed the Digital Country Index<ref>http://placebrandobserver.com/digital-country-index-2017/</ref>.
==External links== * [http://www.bloom-consulting.com/ Bloom Consulting] * [http://countrybranding-josefilipetorres.blogspot.com// Country Branding Blog] * [http://www.economist.com/ The Economist] * [http://www.CNN.com/ CNN] * [http://www.imdb.es/name/nm4145236/ Spanish imdb]

'''Juan Francisco Beckmann Vidal''' (born February 1940)<ref>{{cite web|url=https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/officers/68iCGcJwyTW9BklWER3HyVW7xk4/appointments |title=Juan BECKMANN VIDAL - Personal Appointments (free information from Companies House) |publisher=Beta.companieshouse.gov.uk |date= |accessdate=2017-02-15}}</ref> is a Mexican [[billionaire]] businessman, the owner of 70% of the [[José Cuervo]] tequila brand.<ref>{{cite web|last=Quinn |first=James |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/newsbysector/retailandconsumer/9178083/Why-Diageo-wants-a-tequila-sunrise-down-Mexico-way.html |title=Why Diageo wants a tequila sunrise down Mexico way |publisher=Telegraph |date=2012-03-31 |accessdate=2017-02-15}}</ref><ref name="bloombergtwotequilabillionaireswho">{{cite news|last1=Schmidt|first1=Blake|title=Two Tequila Billionaires Who Won't Be Intimidated by Drug Lords|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2016-02-05/two-tequila-billionaires-who-won-t-be-intimidated-by-drug-lords|accessdate=February 14, 2017|work=Bloomberg|date=February 5, 2016|quote=Beckmann Vidal, who owns 70 percent of the family business through Becle -- a merged company created in a recent corporate restructuring -- has a fortune valued at $2.4 billion, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index.}}</ref>
==Early life== Juan Beckmann Vidal was born in [[Mexico City]], and grew up in Tijuana.<ref name="mexicoperspective1">{{cite web|url=http://mexicoperspective.com/juan-beckmann-vidal-tequila-tourism.html |title=juan beckmann vidal tequila tourism - jose cuervo |publisher=Mexicoperspective.com |date= |accessdate=2017-02-15}}</ref>
==Career== In 1970, Beckmann Vidal took charge of the tequila maker [[José Cuervo]], which has been owned by his family for 11 generations.<ref name="mexicoperspective1"/><ref name="Forbes profile"/>
In 2011, Beckmann Vidal was still president of José Cuervo.<ref name="mexicoperspective1"/>
==Personal life== He is married to Maria de Jesus Dora Legorreta Santos, they have three children, and live in [[Mexico City]].<ref name="Forbes profile"/><ref name="auto">{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/doliaestevez/2017/08/29/tequila-tycoon-juan-beckmann-only-mexican-billionaire-known-to-own-condos-at-trump-tower/#60f04dd0313e|title=Tequila Tycoon Juan Beckmann, Only Mexican Billionaire Known To Own Condos At Trump Tower|first=Dolia|last=Estevez|date=|website=forbes.com|accessdate=19 September 2018}}</ref> Together with his son, through Fambech Luxco, a Luxembourg company, he owns three apartments on the 31st floor of New York's [[Trump Tower]].<ref name="auto"/>
His son [[Juan Domingo Beckmann]], is the chief executive officer (CEO) of Jose Cuervo.<ref name="bloombergtwotequilabillionaireswho"/>

[[File:Trólebus da CMTC.jpg|thumb|right|Mafersa trolleybus that belonged to CMTC, former transportation authority of [[São Paulo]], [[Brazil]]]] [[File:Trolebus de Santos.JPG|thumb|right|Mafersa/Villares trolleybus on route 20 in [[Santos, São Paulo|Santos]], Brazil]]
'''Mafersa S.A.''' is a [[Brazil]]ian manufacturer of passenger rail cars, buses and [[trolleybus]]es, and related components. It was founded in 1944 and was located in the city of [[São Paulo]].<ref name="janes1997">Bushell, Chris (Ed.) (1997). ''Jane's Urban Transport Systems 1997-98'', p. 451. Coulsdon, Surrey (UK): [[Jane's Information Group]]. {{ISBN|0-7106-1562-0}}.</ref> At the end of 1997 it became a subsidiary of [[Alstom]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Mafersa S.A.|publisher=[[Bloomberg Businessweek]]|url=http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapId=64783325 | accessdate=2010-09-13}}</ref>
Most of its customers were in Brazil. However, export orders included, in 1990–92, 38 stainless-steel [[Push-pull train|push-pull]] [[commuter rail]] cars for the [[Virginia Railway Express]]<ref name="janes1991">Bushell, Chris (Ed.) (1991). ''Jane's Urban Transport Systems 1991'', p. 409. Coulsdon, Surrey (UK): Jane's Information Group. {{ISBN|0-7106-0951-5}}.</ref> (10 [[Control car (rail)|control cars]] [cab-equipped trailers] and 28 trailers)<ref>Middleton, William D.; and [[Mac Sebree|Sebree, Mac]] (1994). ''North American Commuter Rail 1994'', pp. 16 and 47. Pasadena (CA), US: [[Pentrex]]. ISSN 0160-6913.</ref> and 256 [[Rapid transit|metro]]-car bodyshells for the [[Chicago Transit Authority]] (as a subcontractor to [[Morrison-Knudsen]]).<ref name="janes1991"/> In the mid-1980s the company built more than 270 [[Rapid transit|metro]] cars for [[Rio de Janeiro Metro|Rio de Janeiro]] and more than 400 for [[São Paulo Metro|São Paulo]], and these were built under license from the [[Budd Company]].<ref name="janes1984">Bushell, Chris; and Stonham, Peter (Eds.) (1984). ''Jane's Urban Transport Systems 1984'', p. 18. London: [[Jane's Information Group|Jane's Publishing Company]]. {{ISBN|0-7106-0792-X}}.</ref>
In addition to building new rail vehicles, Mafersa also carried out overhauls of existing rail cars.<ref name="janes1997"/>
In 1997, Mafersa was acquired by Alstom. A subsidiary of Alstom keeping the same name, Mafersa SA, continued producing rail vehicle components (such as wheels and [[axle]]s), while manufacturing of rail cars also continued but now under the name, "Alstom Transporte do Brazil S.A."<ref name="janes1999">Pattison, Tony (Ed.) (1999). ''Jane's Urban Transport Systems 1999-2000'', p. 440. Coulsdon, Surrey (UK): Jane's Information Group. {{ISBN|0-7106-1921-9}}.</ref> Alstom sold the technology and license of Mafersa SA to MWL Brasil Rodas & Eixos Ltda. in November 1999, and this company continued making rail-vehicle components, initially under the Mafersa name.<ref name="janes2002">Pattison, Tony (Ed.) (2002). ''Jane's Urban Transport Systems 2002-2003'', p. 471. Coulsdon, Surrey (UK): Jane's Information Group. {{ISBN|0-7106-2452-2}}.</ref>
==Buses== Mafersa entered the field of bus manufacturing in 1985, with development of a bus chassis and a [[monocoque]] (or integral) trolleybus.<ref name="janes1989">Bushell, Chris (Ed.) (1989). ''Jane's Urban Transport Systems 1989'', p. 451. Coulsdon, Surrey (UK): [[Jane's Information Group]]. {{ISBN|0-7106-0881-0}}.</ref> Production of [[trolleybus]]es lasted only from 1986 until 1988 and was relatively small, totalling only 85 vehicles, of which 84 were two-axle vehicles and one was [[articulated bus|articulated]].<ref name="Murray">Murray, Alan (2000). ''World Trolleybus Encyclopaedia'', p. 95. Yateley, Hampshire, UK: Trolleybooks. {{ISBN|0-904235-18-1}}.</ref> Between the start of production in 1985/86 and 1988 more than 600 diesel buses had been delivered to various cities.<ref name="janes1989"/>

'''Micro businesses in the Philippines''' can be defined according to the size of assets, size of equity capital, and number of employees. A typical micro business is a business that employs nine people or fewer, with assets of {{Philippine peso|3 million and below}}.
In the Philippines, about 90 percent of all businesses are categorized as micro businesses. These consist of enterprises engaged in industry, agribusiness and or services, whether single proprietorship, cooperative, partnership or corporation. Their total assets, inclusive of those arising from loans but exclusive of the land on which the particular business entity’s office, plant and equipment are situated, have value of not more than {{Philippine peso|3 million}}.
Of all micro businesses, about 46 percent are involved in the wholesale, retail and repair business; 27.6 percent are in the accommodations and food service; 13.5 percent are in manufacturing; while 12.5 percent are engaged in other service categories.
== History == The “''[[Magna Carta]]'' for Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs)” is a landmark legislation that defines the current national policy to promote, support, strengthen, and encourage the growth and development of MSMEs.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://businesstips.ph/how-to-register-as-a-barangay-micro-business-enterprise-bmbe-in-the-philippines/|title=How to Register as a Barangay Micro Business Enterprise (BMBE) in the Philippines {{!}} Business Tips Philippines|website=businesstips.ph|language=en-US|access-date=2017-05-04}}</ref>
Enacted by the [[Philippine Congress]] in 1991 as RA 6977, amended by Republic Act 8289 in 1997, and further amended by RA 9501 in 2008, the law is geared towards the development of the Filipino entrepreneurial spirit by providing a business environment conducive for MSMEs.
The full texts of RA 6977, RA 8289, and RA 9501 and its IRR including the revised rules and regulations governing the mandatory allocation of credit resources provide ready reference for a complete compilation of laws on the ''Magna Carta'' for MSMEs.
== Comparison to other business models == Here is a quick guide to properly differentiate a micro business from other types of businesses: {| class="wikitable" !Category !Assets !No. of Employees |- |Micro |{{Philippine peso|3 million and below}} |9 employees or less |- |Small |{{Philippine peso|3-15 million}} |10-99 employees |- |Medium |{{Philippine peso|15-100 million}} |100-199 employees |- |Large |{{Philippine peso|100 million and above}} |200 employees and up |} MSMEs businesses are driven by profitability and stable long-term value.
A startup business’ objectives are focused on top-end revenue and growth potential. As defined by Steve Banks : “Start-up entrepreneurs have a more idealistic mentality, being more socialist, vs. the SME entrepreneurs, which are more financially driven. It is a “temporary organization designed to search for a repeatable and scalable business model.” A startup is searching for answers to the product it will sell, the customer it will serve and the way it will make money from delivering value to its customers.
== Barangay Micro Business Enterprise (BMBE) == A business which falls under the ''Republic Act 9501 Magna Carta for Micro, Small, Medium Enterprise (MSME)'' is eligible of the following incentives from the BMBE: # Income tax exemption from income arising from the operations of the enterprise # Exemption from the coverage of the Minimum Wage Law (BMBE employees will still receive the same social security and health care benefits as other employees) # Priority to a special credit window set up specifically for the financing requirements of BMBEs # Technology transfer, production and management training, and marketing assistance programs for BMBE beneficiaries. The government, in its objective to strengthen Barangay Micro Business Enterprises in the country and provide more jobs, livelihood and a better quality of life for Filipinos, has enacted Republic Act 9178, otherwise known as the “Barangay Micro Business Enterprises Act of 2002”.
In other words, a business or activity may be eligible to register as BMBE if they meet the following criteria: # The business enterprise is engaged in production, processing, or manufacturing of products, including agro-processing, as well as trading and services. # The business enterprise has total assets of {{Philippine peso|3 million}} or less including those arising from loans but excluding the land on which the plant and equipment are located. # The business enterprise or service provider, in connection with his or her exercise of profession, is not a professional who is duly licensed by the government after having passed a government licensure examination for aspiring accountants, lawyers, doctors, and other professions. # The business enterprise is not a branch, subsidiary, division or office of a large scale enterprise or it is not a franchisee.
== Recent Developments == Senator [[Bam Aquino]] was reported to announce his intention to pass two bills on MSMEs within a year. These are: the Small Business Tax Reform Act, which aims to give MSMEs a three-year operation period before imposing taxes; and the Philippine Startup Bill, which seeks to provide a viable environment for startups.
President Rodrigo Duterte has announced during his [[2016 State of the Nation Address (Philippines)|SONA held on July 25, 2016]] that he vows to carry out the following during his term: # Improve the Ease of Doing Business ranking of the Philippines # Cut processing times and streamline requirements by: #* Addressing bottlenecks in business registration and processing #* Streamlining investment applications processes #* Integrating the services of various government offices DTI Region 10 has held the "Negosyo Konsumer at iba pa" for MSMEs and consumers last August 17–19, 2016 in [[Cagayan de Oro]].
The activity included the launching of a fabrication laboratory; innovation technopreneurship; the Negosyo Center in the region; an E-Commerce forum; and a host of trainings for various business types.
== "ThinkMicro" Model == Since the third quarter of 2016, a move to empower micro businesses through an active eco system of support through funding, logistics and creative guidance has begun to take place. The move challenges everyone to consider the micro business model as a viable business option, and empowers aspiring entrepreneurs to pursue their business goals with the support they need. It gives due emphasis to the microbusiness model and how it can grow into a strong and stable enterprise that generates a steady stream of income, enough for it to expand as a world-class conglomerate while staying in the micro model.
It challenges the status quo to #thinkmicro, as the current hashtag relating to this school of thought suggests.
The move is both a nod and a push toward greater influence to earlier efforts of business advocates with similar intentions. Among them, the Go Negosyo]and DTI’s Kapatid campaign; Josiah Go's mentoring programs; and [[PLDT]]'s SME Nation "Ka-Asenso" campaign.
== References == * http://businesstips.ph/how-to-register-as-a-barangay-micro-business-enterprise-bmbe-in-the-philippines/ * http://www.senate.gov.ph/publications/AG%202012-03%20-%20MSME.pdf * http://businesstips.ph/small-businesses-in-the-philippines/ * https://www.forbes.com/sites/theyec/2012/08/15/are-you-building-a-small-business-or-a-startup/#4a0a463114f9 * https://www.quora.com/Whats-the-difference-between-a-startup-and-an-SME-small-medium-enterprise * http://philippines.smetoolkit.org/philippine/en/content/en/6887/RA-9501-Magna-Carta-for-Micro-Small-and-Medium-Enterprises
;Notes <references />

{{Infobox person | native_name = Николай Алексеевич Глушков | native_name_lang = ru | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_name = Nikolay Alekseevich Glushkov | birth_date = {{Birth date|1949|12|24|df=yes}} | birth_place = Russia | death_date = {{death date and age|2018|3|12|1949|12|24|df=yes}} | death_place = [[New Malden]], London | spouse = | children = }}
'''Nikolay Alekseevich Glushkov''' ({{lang-ru|Николай Алексеевич Глушков}}; 24 December 1949 – 12 March 2018)<ref name=guardianmarch2018>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2018/mar/13/russian-exile-nikolai-glushkov-found-dead-at-his-london-home?CMP=share_btn_tw |title=Russian exile Nikolai Glushkov found dead at his London home |last=Harding |first=Luke |date=2018-03-13 |website=www.theguardian.com |publisher= |access-date=2018-03-13}}</ref> was a Russian businessman who was the deputy director of [[Aeroflot]] and a finance manager for [[AvtoVAZ]]. After claiming that Aeroflot worked as a "cash cow to support international spying operations", he was arrested and tried in Russia on the allegation of channeling Aeroflot money through another company in 1999. He was convicted and released in 2004, after serving three years. He emigrated to the UK in 2010 and received [[Right of asylum|political asylum]]. In 2017 he was convicted [[Trial in absentia|in absentia]] in Russia for allegedly stealing money from Aeroflot, but his extradition from Britain had been denied. Initially treated as "unexplained", his death is being investigated by the [[Metropolitan Police Service|Metropolitan Police]] who are now treating it as a murder inquiry.<ref name="BBC160318">{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-43433552|title=Murder inquiry over Russian's London death|date=16 March 2018|work=BBC News}}</ref>
==Biography== ===Early life=== In 1972, Nikolai Glushkov graduated from the Moscow [[Peoples' Friendship University of Russia|Peoples' Friendship University]] with a degree in physics. In 1981, he completed the [[All-Russian Academy of Foreign Trade|Academy of Foreign Trade]] with a degree in economics.
=== His Aeroflot job, arrests, trials, and convictions=== Glushkov had been AvtoVAZ's Finance Chief until he left his job in autumn 1995 and was appointed as Deputy General Director of [[Aeroflot]] on request from [[Yevgeny Shaposhnikov]] in February 1996.<ref>{{Cite book |title=Godfather of the Kremlin: The Decline of Russia in the Age of Gangster Capitalism |last=Klebnikov |first=Paul |isbn=0-15-601330-4 |page=176}}</ref> According to [[Alexander Goldfarb (biologist)|Alexander Goldfarb]], he found that the airline company worked as a "cash cow to support international spying operations":<ref name="dissident">{{Cite book |title=[[Death of a Dissident|Death of a Dissident: The Poisoning of Alexander Litvinenko and the Return of the KGB]] |last=Goldfarb |first=Alex |last2=Litvinenko |first2=Marina |date=2007 |publisher=The Free Press |isbn=1-4165-5165-4 |author-link=Alexander Goldfarb (biologist)}}</ref> 3,000 people out of the total workforce of 14,000 in Aeroflot were [[Federal Security Service|FSB]], [[Foreign Intelligence Service (Russia)|SVR]], or [[Main Intelligence Directorate|GRU]] officers. All proceeds from ticket sales were distributed to 352 foreign bank accounts that could not be controlled by the Aeroflot administration. Glushkov closed all these accounts and channeled the money to Swiss company called Andava in [[Switzerland]].<ref name="dissident" /> He also sent a bill and wrote a letter to SVR director [[Yevgeny Primakov]] and FSB director [[Mikhail Barsukov]], asking them to pay the salaries of their intelligence officers in Aeroflot in 1996.<ref name="dissident" /> Both Glushkov and [[Boris Berezovsky (businessman)|Berezovsky]] were the main [[shareholder]]s of Andava at that time.<ref name="rian">{{Cite web |url=http://www.rian.ru/spravka/20071122/89057348.html |title=Aeroflot case. What Berezovsky is accused of? |date=2007-11-22 |publisher=[[RIA Novosti]] |lang=Russian}}</ref>
In 1996, a Forbes article claimed that Glushkov was convicted of theft in 1982.<ref name="forbes">{{Cite news |url=https://www.forbes.com/forbes/1996/1230/5815090a.html#92687067562d |title=Godfather of the Kremlin? |date=6 March 2003 |work=Forbes |access-date=2018-06-17 |language=en |orig-year=Dec. 30, 1996}}</ref> Glushkov and Berezovsky sued Forbes for libel in the United Kingdom, with the ruling coming down against the publisher.<ref name="forbes" /><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/nikolai-glushkov-who-was-russian-businessman-murdered-strangled-vladimir-putin-boris-berezovsky-a8260261.html|title=Who was the exiled Russian businessman murdered in London?|work=The Independent|access-date=2018-06-17|language=en-GB}}</ref>
Glushkov was arrested in December 2000 by Russian law enforcers and charged with channeling money through his accounting center ''Andava''. He was a business partner and close friend of [[Boris Berezovsky (businessman)|Boris Berezovsky]], who from November 2000 resided in Britain; Berezovsky had to give up his ownership of the [[Channel One Russia|ORT]] TV channel<ref name="one">{{Cite journal |date=January 3, 2001 |title=ORT Officials Accused of Contraband and Evading Customs Tariffs |url=http://www.jamestown.org/publications_details.php?volume_id=24&issue_id=1931&article_id=17910 |journal=MONITOR |issue=2 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20061122183938/http://www.jamestown.org/publications_details.php?volume_id=24&issue_id=1931&article_id=17910 |archive-date=2006-11-22 |via=[[The Jamestown Foundation]]}}</ref> transferred them to [[Roman Abramovich]]'s [[Gazprom Neft|Sibneft]]) in exchange for the promise to release Glushkov, which was not fulfilled.<ref name="two">{{Cite web |url=http://www.lib.ru/HISTORY/FELSHTINSKY/naslednik.txt |title=Владимир Прибыловский, Юрий Фельштинский. Операция "Наследник". Штрихи к политическому портрету В. В. Путина |last=Pribylovsky |first=Vladimir |authorlink=Vladimir Pribylovsky |last2=Felshtinsky |first2=Yuri |authorlink2=Yuri Felshtinsky |trans-title=The Operation "Successor" |lang=ru}}</ref>
In April 2001 [[Andrey Lugovoy]] organized an "escape" of Glushkov from a hospital where he was kept by authorities. According to Glushkov, that was a set-up by FSB. He had no intention to escape and "was walking in his slippers to the hospital gate to go home for the night, with his guards' knowledge, as he had done a few days earlier".<ref name="dissident" />
During his trial, Glushkov was incarcerated in [[Lefortovo Prison]]. He was cleared of the original fraud and money laundering charges by the court in March 2004, but found guilty of attempted escape and "abuse of authority"<ref name="dissident" /> and sentenced to 3 years and 3 months of imprisonment. Glushkov was released in the courtroom, since he had already served his sentence in the pre-trial detention center. However, the Moscow City Court rejected the verdict and returned the case for new consideration. In 2006, the Savelovsky District Court terminated the prosecution of Glushkov, but gave him a two years of suspended sentence.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://graniru.org/Events/Crime/m.268403.html |title=Не своя смерть: Британская полиция расследует смерть Глушкова как убийство |date=16 March 2018 |trans-title=Not my own death: British police investigates death of Glushkov as murder |lang=Russian}}</ref>
=== Emigration to UK and extradition request === Gluskov emigrated to the UK and received [[Right of asylum|political asylum]] in 2010.<ref name="bbcconter" /> The Russian state resumed his criminal prosecution. In 2017, during a trial ''in absentia'' in Russia, Glushkov was sentenced to eight years in prison for allegedly stealing $123 million from Aeroflot.<ref name=guardianmarch2018 /><ref>{{cite web | url= http://www.rapsinews.com/judicial_news/20170303/277922666.html | title=Prosecutor again seeks 8 years in jail for Aeroflot ex-manager in embezzlement case | author=<!--Not stated--> | date=2017-03-03 | website=www.rapsinews.com | publisher=Russian Legal Information Agency | access-date=2018-03-13}}</ref> The UK refused to extradite him to Russia.<ref name="cnnfoundead" />
=== Death === On 13 March 2018, friends of Glushkov revealed that he had been found dead the night before in his home in [[New Malden]], London. His death was initially treated by police as unexplained. His death came a week after the [[poisoning of Sergei and Yulia Skripal]] in [[Salisbury]], which along with his reputation as a critic of the Putin government, was said to be the reason for putting the [[Counter Terrorism Command]] in charge of the investigation.<ref name="bbcconter">{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-43385998|title=Counter-terror police investigate death|date=13 March 2018|work=[[BBC News]]}}</ref><ref name="cnnfoundead">{{cite news|url=https://edition.cnn.com/2018/03/13/europe/nikolai-glushkov-russia-intl/index.html |title=Russian emigre Nikolai Glushkov found dead in London home|date=13 March 2018|work=[[CNN]]}}</ref> Glushkov reportedly feared being on Putin's hit list and expected to be a likely target.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/russian-exile-nikolai-glushkov-feared-12183797|title=Russian exile feared he was on Putin's hit-list five years before his death|first=Natalie|last=Evans|date=14 March 2018|publisher=|access-date=14 March 2018}}</ref>
During the subsequent post-mortem his body was found to have marks consistent with [[Strangling|strangulation]] on the [[neck]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2018/03/13/russian-businessman-close-associate-ofboris-berezovsky-found/|title=Putin enemy found dead in London eight days after Skripal poisoning, as counter-terror police launch investigation|first1=Robert|last1=Mendick|first2=Hayley|last2=Dixon|first3=Roland|last3=Oliphant|first4=Tom|last4=Ball|first5=Helena|last5=Horton|first6=Patrick|last6=Sawer|first7=Gordon|last7=Rayner|date=13 March 2018|work=The Daily Telegraph|access-date=14 March 2018|via=www.telegraph.co.uk}}</ref><ref name="cnnfoundead" /> On 16 March 2018, the [[Metropolitan Police Service|Metropolitan Police]] stated they were now treating his death as murder. However, they stated that "at this stage there is nothing to suggest any link to the attempted murders in Salisbury".<ref name="BBC160318"/> Counter-terrorism investigators maintain a lead role in the investigation. The Russian Embassy in London has requested a meeting with the head of Scotland Yard over its investigation into the murder.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2018/mar/16/police-launch-inquiry-over-death-of-nikolai-glushkov|title=Police launch murder inquiry over death of Nikolai Glushkov|last=Booth|first=Robert|last2=Harding|first2=Luke|date=2018-03-17|website=the Guardian|language=en|access-date=2018-06-17|last3=Roth|first3=Andrew|last4=Wintour|first4=Patrick}}</ref>
It was reported after his death that Glushkov may have been poisoned by two Russian men five years earlier. A paramedic said that he treated Mr Glushkov in [[Bristol]] in 2013 after he had collapsed in his room. He had been sharing drinks with two men from Moscow the night before at the [[Grand Hotel (Bristol)|Grand Hotel]] in [[Bristol]] and believed he had been poisoned with champagne. The paramedics found him with multiple carpet burns of his body and an unusual heart rhythm which they could not recognise<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-45455464|title=Murdered Russian 'believed he was poisoned'|date=2018-09-08|work=BBC News|access-date=2018-09-16|language=en-GB}}</ref>.

{{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} '''Process costing''' is an accounting methodology that traces and accumulates [[direct cost]]s, and allocates [[indirect cost]]s of a manufacturing process. Costs are assigned to products, usually in a large batch, which might include an entire month's production. Eventually, costs have to be allocated to individual units of product. It assigns average costs to each unit, and is the opposite extreme of [[Job costing]] which attempts to measure individual costs of production of each unit. Process costing is usually a significant chapter. It is a method of assigning costs to units of production in companies producing large quantities of homogeneous products..
Process costing is a type of operation costing which is used to ascertain the [[cost]] of a product at each process or stage of manufacture. [[Chartered Institute of Management Accountants|CIMA]] defines process costing as "The costing method applicable where goods or services result from a sequence of continuous or repetitive operations or processes. Costs are averaged over the units produced during the period". Process costing is suitable for industries producing homogeneous products and where production is a continuous flow. A process can be referred to as the sub-unit of an organization specifically defined for cost collection purpose.
==The importance of process costing== Costing is an important process that many companies engage in to keep track of where their money is being spent in the [[Production (economics)|production]] and distribution processes. Understanding these costs is the first step in being able to control them. It is very important that a company chooses the appropriate type of costing [[system]] for their product type and industry. One type of costing system that is used in certain industries is '''process costing''' that varies from other types of costing (such as [[job costing]]) in some ways. In process costing unit costs are more like averages, the process-costing system requires less bookkeeping than does a job-order costing system. Thus, some companies often prefer to use the process-costing system.
==When is process costing applied?== Process costing is appropriate for companies that produce a continuous mass of like units through series of operations or process. Also, when one order does not affect the production process and a standardization of the process and product exists. However, if there are significant differences among the costs of various [[product (business)|products]], a process costing system would not provide adequate product-cost information. Costing is generally used in such [[industries]] such as petroleum, coal mining, chemicals, textiles, paper, plastic, glass, food, banks, courier, cement, and soap.
==Reasons for use== Compan units of product in a given period of time. *Products are manufactured in large quantities, but products may be sold in small quantities, sometimes one at a time ([[automobiles]], loaves of bread), a dozen or two at a time (eggs, cookies), etc. *Product costs must be transferred from Finished Goods to Cost of Goods Sold as sales are made. This requires a correct and accurate accounting of product costs per unit, to have a proper matching of product costs against related sales revenue. *Managers need to maintain cost control over the [[manufacturing]] process. Process costing provides managers with feedback that can be used to compare similar product costs from one month to the next, keeping costs in line with projected manufacturing budgets. *A fraction-of-a-cent cost change can represent a large dollar change in overall [[Profit (accounting)|profitability]], when selling millions of units of product a month. Managers must carefully watch per unit costs on a daily basis through the production process, while at the same time dealing with materials and output in huge quantities. *Materials part way through a process (e.g. chemicals) might need to be given a value, process costing allows for this. By determining what cost the part processed material has incurred such as labor or overhead an "equivalent unit" relative to the value of a finished process can be calculated.''
==Process cost procedures== There are '''four basic steps''' in [[accounting]] for Process cost: * Summarize the flow of physical units of output. * Compute output in terms of equivalent units. * Summarize total costs to account for and Compute equivalent unit costs. * Assign total costs to units completed and to units in ending work in process [[inventory]].
The journal entries for process costing are the same as those for job-order costing with one exception. The entry to transfer cost from one work-in-process account to another is:
Work-in-process inventory-second department Debit (Left)
Work-in-process-first department Credit (Right)
e.g.(1) Micro Labs Company produces house paint in two processing departments: the Mixing Department which mixes the paint colors and the Finishing Department which puts the paint in containers and labels them. The following information related to the company’s operation for October follows:
A) Raw materials were issued for use in production: Mixing department, $551,000, and the Finishing department, $629,000. B) Direct labor costs incurred: Mixing department $230,000, and Finishing department $270,000. C) Manufacturing overhead cost applied: Mixing department $665,000, and Finishing department, $405,000. D) The cost of the mixed paint transferred from the Mixing department to the Finishing department was $1,850,000. E) Paint that had been prepared for shipping was transferred from the Finishing department to Finished Goods. Cost of the transferred paint was $3,200,000.
Required: Prepare journal entries to record items A) through E) above.
Solution(1):
–Work in Process – Mixing 551,000 –Work in Process – Finishing 629,000 –Raw Materials 1,180,000 –Work in Process – Mixing 230,000 –Work in Process – Finishing 270,000 –Wages and Salaries Payable 500,000 –Work in Process – Mixing 665,000 –Work in Process – Finishing 405,000 –Manufacturing Overhead 1,070,000 –Work in Process – Finishing 1,850,000 –Work in Process – Mixing 1,850,000 –Finished Goods 3,200,000 –Work in Process – Finishing 3,200,000
e.g.(2) Larney Corporation uses process costing. A number of transactions that occurred in June are listed below. As follows:
A) Raw materials that cost $38,200 are withdrawn from the storeroom for use in the Mixing Department. B) Direct labor costs incurred $36,500,in the Mixing Department. C) Manufacturing overhead of $42,100 is applied in the Mixing Department. D) Units with a carrying cost of $112,400 finish processing in the Mixing Department and are transferred to the Drying Department for further processing. E) Units with a carrying cost of $143,800 finish processing in the Drying Department, the final step in the production process, and are transferred to the finished goods warehouse. F) Finished goods with a carrying cost of $138,500
Required: Prepare journal entries to record items A) through F).
Solution (2):
–work in process-mixing department $38,200 —raw materials $38,200 –work in process $36,500 –salaries/wages payable $36,500 –work in process-mixing department $42,100 –manufacturing overhead $42,100 –work in process-drying department. $112,400 –work in process mixing department $112,400 –finished goods $143,800 –work in process-drying department $143,800 -costs of goods sold $138,500 –finished goods $138,500
==Operation cost in batch manufacturing== [[Batch production|Batch]] costing is a modification of [[job costing]]. When production is repetitive nature and consists of a definite number of articles, batch is used. In batch costing, the most important problem is to determine the optimum size of the batch that follows the fact that production of two elements of costs: * Set up costs which are generally fixed per batch. * Carrying costs which vadetermination of batch quantity requires considerations of some factors: * setting up costs per batch. * cost of [[manufacturing]] such as ([[direct materials cost]] + direct [[wages]] + direct overhead) per piece. * cost of [[Warehouse|storage]]. * rate of interest on the capital invested in product and rate of demand for product.
==References== *{{Cite book | author=Jae K. Shim, Joel G. Siegel| title=Modern Cost Management and Analysis 3rd Ed| publisher=Barron's Education Series, Inc | year=2009,2000,1992 | editor= | isbn=978-0-7641-4103-4}} *{{Cite book | author=Bhabatosh Banerjee| title=Cost Accounting Theory And Practice 12Th Ed| publisher= | year=| editor= | isbn=}}
